Namespace: server

server

Methods for interacting with the Server endpoints
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server
Source:
  • server.js, line 1

Methods

addIPv4(parameters)

Add a new IPv4 address to a server. You will start being billed for this immediately. The server will be rebooted unless you specify otherwise. You must reboot the server before the IPv4 address can be configured.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_create_ipv4
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.
reboot string <optional>
 'yes' 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, the server is rebooted immediately.
Source:
  • server.js, line 668

appInfo(parameters)

Retrieves the application information for this subscription.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_get_app_info
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.

  • server.js, line 350

Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.

changeApp(parameters)

Enables private networking on a server. The server will be automatically rebooted to complete the request. No action occurs if private networking was already enabled.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_app_change
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.
APPID number Application to use.
Source:
  • server.js, line 527

changeOS(parameters)

Changes the virtual machine to a different operating system. All data will be permanently lost.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_os_change
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.
OSID number Operating system to use.
Source:
  • server.js, line 371

create(parameters)

Create a new virtual machine. You will start being billed for this immediately. The response only contains the SUBID for the new machine.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_create
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
DCID number <optional>
 Location to create this virtual machine in.
VPSPLANID number <optional>
 Plan to use when creating this virtual machine.
OSID number <optional>
 Operating system to use.
ipxe_chain string <optional>
 If you've selected the 'custom' operating system, this can be set to chainload the specified URL on bootup, via iPXE.
ISOID string <optional>
 If you've selected the 'custom' operating system, this is the ID of a specific ISO to mount during the deployment.
SCRIPTID number <optional>
 If you've not selected a 'custom' operating system, this can be the SCRIPTID of a startup script to execute on boot.
SNAPSHOTID string <optional>
 If you've selected the 'snapshot' operating system, this should be the SNAPSHOTID to restore for the initial installation.
enable_ipv6 string <optional>
 'no' 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, an IPv6 subnet will be assigned to the machine (where available).
enable_private_network string <optional>
 'no' 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, private networking support will be added to the new server.
NETWORKID array <optional>
 List of private networks to attach to this server. Use either this field or enable_private_network, not both.
label string <optional>
 This is a text label that will be shown in the control panel.
SSHKEYID string <optional>
 List of SSH keys to apply to this server on install (only valid for Linux/FreeBSD). Separate keys with commas.
auto_backups string <optional>
 'no' 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, automatic backups will be enabled for this server (these have an extra charge associated with them).
APPID number <optional>
 If launching an application (OSID 186), this is the APPID to launch.
userdata string <optional>
 Base64 encoded user-data.
notify_activate string <optional>
 'yes' 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, an activation email will be sent when the server is ready.
ddos_protection string <optional>
 'no' 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, DDOS protection will be enabled on the subscription (there is an additional charge for this).
reserved_ip_v4 string <optional>
 IP address of the floating IP to use as the main IP of this server.
hostname string <optional>
 The hostname to assign to this server.
tag string <optional>
 The tag to assign to this server.
FIREWALLGROUPID string <optional>
 The firewall group to assign to this server.
Source:
  • server.js, line 43

delete(parameters)

Destroy (delete) a virtual machine. All data will be permanently lost, and the IP address will be released. There is no going back from this call.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_destroy
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.
Source:
  • server.js, line 257

deleteReverseIPv6(parameters)

Remove a reverse DNS entry for an IPv6 address of a virtual machine. Upon success, DNS changes may take 6-12 hours to become active.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_reverse_delete_ipv6
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.
ip string IPv6 address used in the reverse DNS update.
Source:

disablePrivateNetwork(parameters)

Removes a private network from a server. The server will be automatically rebooted to complete the request.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_private_network_disable
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.
NETWORKID string Unique identifier for the private network to remove from this subscription. This field is optional if there is only one private network in a given location.

Parameters:

halt(parameters)

Halt a virtual machine. This is a hard power off (basically, unplugging the machine). The data on the machine will not be modified, and you will still be billed for the machine.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_halt

parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description

ipv4Info(parameters)

List the IPv4 information of a virtual machine. IP information is only available for virtual machines in the "active" state.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_list_ipv4
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.
public_network string <optional>
 'no' 'yes' or 'no'. If 'yes', include information about the public network adapter (such as MAC address) with the "main_ip" entry.
Source:
  • server.js, line 819

ipv6Info(parameters)

List the IPv6 information of a virtual machine. IP information is only available for virtual machines in the "active" state. If the virtual machine does not have IPv6 enabled, then an empty array is returned.

isoStatus(parameters)

Retrieve the current ISO state for a given subscription. The returned state may be one of: ready | isomounting | isomounted. ISOID will only be set when the mounted ISO exists in your library. Otherwise, it will read "0".
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_iso_status
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.
Source:
  • server.js, line 996

list(parameters)

List all active or pending virtual machines on the current account.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_server_list
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
SUBID number <optional>
 Unique identifier of a subscription. Only the subscription object will be returned.
tag string <optional>
 A tag string. Only subscription objects with this tag will be returned.
label string <optional>
 A text label string. Only subscription objects with this text label will be returned.
main_ip string <optional>
 An IPv4 address. Only the subscription matching this IPv4 address will be returned.
Source:
  • server.js, line 7

listApps(parameters)

Retrieves a list of applications to which a virtual machine can be changed. Always check against this list before trying to switch applications because it is not possible to switch between every application combination.

reinstall(parameters)

Reinstall the operating system on a virtual machine. All data will be permanently lost, but the IP address will remain the same. There is no going back from this call.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_reinstall

Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.

setBackupSchedule(parameters)

Sets the backup schedule for a server. All time values are in UTC.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_backup_set_schedule
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.
cron_type string Backup cron type. Can be one of 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'daily_alt_even', or 'daily_alt_odd'.
hour number <optional>
 Hour value (0-23). Applicable to crons: 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'daily_alt_even', 'daily_alt_odd'.
dow number <optional>
 Day-of-week value (0-6). Applicable to crons: 'weekly'.
dom number <optional>
 Day-of-month value (1-28). Applicable to crons: 'monthly'.
Source:
  • server.js, line 736

setUserData(parameters)

Sets the user-data for this subscription. User-data is a generic data store, which some provisioning tools and cloud operating systems use as a configuration file. It is generally consumed only once after an instance has been launched, but individual needs may vary.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#server_set_user_data
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SUBID number Unique identifier of a subscription.
userdata string Base64 encoded user-data.
Source:
  • server.js, line 423
